DDS
Class IntMap

java.lang.Object
  DDS.IntMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
Collection
public abstract class IntMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements Collection

The IntMap is an abstract class that represents a Map that can store elements identified by an Integer key type. The operations to store and retrieve elements in the map are implemented in a specialized sub-class.

The Map offers operations that can produce the keys of all elements contained in the Map, the keys of all elements that have been added in the last update round, the keys of all elements that were modified during the last update round, and the keys of all elements that were removed during the last update round. Changes to the map as a result of manipulation by a local application cannot be retrieved this way.

It is possible for an application to remove an element from the map by means of the key that identifies it. This is only possible for Collections that are located in a writeable CacheAccess.

added_elements

public final int[] added_elements()
                           throws AlreadyDeleted
Returns the keys of all elements that were added during the last update round. Changes to the map as a result of manipulation by a local application are not taken into account. It is recommended to use the keys() operation instead of this operation when dealing with a collection belonging to an ObjectRoot with read_state OBJECT_NEW. In this case both lists will be equal and the keys() operation will give better performance. But only in the described case, in other situations it's recommended to use this operation. When this collection belongs to an ObjectRoot with read_state VOID then this operation will always return a zero length array.

Returns:
the keys of all elements that were added during the last update round.
Throws:
AlreadyDeleted - if the map is already deleted.

modified_elements

public final int[] modified_elements()
                              throws AlreadyDeleted
Returns the keys of all elements that were modified during the last update round. Changes to the map as a result of manipulation by a local application are not taken into account. When this collection belongs to an ObjectRoot with read_state VOID or OBJECT_NEW then this operation will always return a zero length array.

Returns:
the keys of all elements that were modified during the last update round.
Throws:
AlreadyDeleted - if the map is already deleted.

removed_elements

public final int[] removed_elements()
                             throws AlreadyDeleted
Returns the keys of all elements that were removed during the last update round. Changes to the map as a result of manipulation by a local application are not taken into account. When this collection belongs to an ObjectRoot with read_state VOID or OBJECT_NEW then this operation will always return a zero length array.

Returns:
the keys of all elements that were removed during the last update round.
Throws:
AlreadyDeleted - if the map is already deleted.

keys

public final int[] keys()
                 throws AlreadyDeleted
Returns the keys of all elements that are contained in the map.

Returns:
the keys of all elements that are contained in the map.
Throws:
AlreadyDeleted - if the map is already deleted.

remove

public final void remove(int key)
                  throws AlreadyDeleted,
                         PreconditionNotMet
Removes the element that is identified by the specified key. A PreconditionNotMet is raised if any of the following preconditions is violated:
  • The Map is not located in a (writeable) CacheAccess;
  • The Map belongs to an ObjectRoot which is not yet registered.

Parameters:
key - the key that identifies the element that is to be removed.
Throws:
AlreadyDeleted - if the map is already deleted.
PreconditionNotMet - if any of the preconditions was not met.
